programme.desc: Detectives take on a decades-long mystery when they reinvestigate the 1984 murder of Mary Mclaughlin. A new suspect comes to the fore, but it raises more questions than answers.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz, packed with strategy, high stakes and surprises, where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret stash of cash - anything between zero and a whopping £4,000.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The roadshow visits Lister Park and Cartwright Hall in Bradford, where treasures include a sketch by John Lennon and a miniature cavalry sword gifted by Queen Victoria.

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights and key analysis from all the days games in the Premier League.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Thirty players compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day.

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and sidekick Sarah Greene host the quiz show where contestants race on moving podiums across the studio floor. Correct answers get the players moving, while wrong answers will stop them in their tracks.

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Marion, Rob, Megan and Stephen battle it out to see which one of them is unbeatable.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its judging day, and only one chef can go through to represent north west England. Campaigner Margaret Aspinall helps decide the winner from the two remaining chefs.

programme.title: Trawlermen: Hunting the Catch
programme.desc: 300,000 sq miles of ocean. Three GPS-tracked voyages, filmed around the clock. One week at sea. Emilia Jayne hunts for cuttlefish in the worlds busiest shipping lane. Cargo ships have right of way here, but lucrative cuttlefish swim in these grounds too. After finding good fishing at the start of his week-long trip, can skipper Luke Selvey keep the secret to himself? Margaret of Ladram is Brixhams most successful trawler.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: This edition of the antiques series comes from St Albans Cathedral and Abbey in Hertfordshire. Experts Claire Rawle and James Lewis are on hand to value items and take them off to auction. James is excited when some historic coins land on his table, and Claire has fun with a 1970s robot.

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Kola Bokinni, Sheli McCoy, John Parrott and Katie Piper test their general knowledge skills on this weeks House of Games.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing: It Takes Two
programme.desc: Fleur East kicks off the week with an exclusive chat with the latest couple to be eliminated from the competition. Choreography Corner looks back at the weekends performances. Plus more interviews and backstage gossip with some of the remaining couples.

programme.title: Global Eye
programme.desc: Bringing forensic journalism from all corners of the world by BBC Eye, the World Services critically acclaimed investigative unit, and featuring expert global correspondents getting to the heart of the biggest international stories.

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts as four more contenders answer questions on specialist subjects, including Richard Nixon, the band Nirvana and the television sitcom Derry Girls.

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts the quiz where knowledge only gets you so far. Both teams won their opening heats, which means nobody goes home.

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: Two of the highest-scoring losing teams from the heats get a second chance to qualify for the second round. Amol Rajan asks the questions.

programme.title: The Lost Letters of Mary, Queen of Scots
programme.desc: Tracing the extraordinary story of the amateur codebreakers who collaborated across continents to decipher a mysterious cache of coded letters which were discovered to be from Mary, Queen of Scots.

programme.title: Leonard and Hungry Paul
programme.desc: After his mothers death, Leonard begins to open up his world with the help of a new colleague, Shelley. His best friend, Hungry Paul, reluctantly volunteers at the hospital.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the days top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

programme.title: BBC Weather
programme.desc: The latest weather forecast.

programme.title: Manhunter
programme.desc: An ex-FBI forensic investigator is called in to track down a brutal serial killer known as the Tooth Fairy. To help him understand the mind of his quarry, he visits the prison which holds an old adversary of his - notorious serial killer Dr Hannibal `the Cannibal Lecktor, but the investigation comes to threaten his sanity and the lives of his family.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Adam Henson are in Herefordshire, the UKs cider capital, at the height of the apple harvest.

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Emotions run high at Waterloo Road when Stellas daughter arrives. Elsewhere, Mitch finds himself in hot water when he steps in to help a struggling student.

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun and Bitzer discover that a visitor to the farm isnt as cute and adorable as she seems.

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: Danger Mouse and Penfold accompany Professor Squawkencluck to the Brainiac Symposium, the annual science convention. There, King Kong Brunelss latest misfiring invention reminds everyone why he is the laughing stock of the scientist community.

programme.title: Super Happy Magic Forest
programme.desc: When Hoofius plays his grandfauns old magical panpipes, his friends do exactly what he asks them to do, perfect for leading a quest, or so he thinks.

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: The kids want to impress Gramps by completing the Gauntlet of Greatness carnival attraction that he did when he was their age. However, Dog and Girl just cant seem to beat it.

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: News magazine keeping young viewers up to date with the latest stories and events happening at home and abroad.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: When the Lemmings spoil Grizzys meal with their new game, the bear throws them out of the hut.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings are holding a log throwing competition that stops short when Grizzy sends them soaring into the distance.

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: The long-lost episode of Mermaid Man is finally showing on TV, but SpongeBob has to make it home in time to watch it.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Villain Miss Information is using graphs to spread falsehoods about Odd Squad, which is leading to the public not trusting them. Captain O tries to get the public back on their side.

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: Two aspiring warrior-heroes and a lively ghost girl refine the skills they need to take the place of an ageing monster-slayer by completing his odd, supernatural chores.

programme.title: Danny and Mick
programme.desc: A special visit from the mayor means that his chains need putting away safely, while he goes for a swim. As head of security, Mick locks them in Joys safe, but due to his forgetfulness, Danny and Mick now need to work out another way to retrieve them before the mayor returns.

programme.title: Bitesize: 5-7 Year Olds
programme.desc: Numbers to 100, finding one more and one less, signs and symbols.

programme.title: Hey You What If?
programme.desc: Explore what would happen if it was possible to build a slide to the other side of the world. You would need to start in space, use the slippiest slide ever and make sure you have enough supplies before you go down it.

programme.title: Out of This World
programme.desc: Dr Maggie tells the story of the Space Race, what it was, the key missions involved and how the USA, competing against and then collaborating with the Soviet Union, got us to where we are today in space. Dr Maggies guest is Tim Peake, the first British astronaut to live on board ISS, who tells us how astronauts from different countries successfully work together in space. And Dr. Maggie answers your space questions and unveils her top five `firsts in space.

programme.title: Our School
programme.desc: The girls get creative, as Daisy and her friends give the common room a colourful makeover, and Eva and Evie enter the school photography competition, with some top tips from wildlife presenter Megan McCubbin.

programme.title: Go Get Arty
programme.desc: Feathers fly as the Kwapongs go full carnival, and Abi Clarke draws a tutu-wearing otter.

programme.title: One Zoo Three
programme.desc: The zoo celebrates the opening of some amazing new animal habitats, including a new den for the sun bears. Plus, finding out whether the jaguars feature pad will be a big hit or miss.

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: Archie is 10 years old and as well as planting, growing and harvesting vegetables, he loves looking after his chickens. Archie sells his home grown veg and eggs locally and uses the profits to buy food for his local food bank. Hes taken his enterprise as far as he can and desperately needs a farm den so he can increase his productivity.

programme.title: Absolute Genius: Monster Builds
programme.desc: Dick and Dom go super-sized in this massive movers spectacular in which they trace the origins of the genius ideas that have made shifting heavy weights a whole lot easier. In their element, the boys head to a scrapyard to find out how hydraulic grabbers work, get up close to one of the weirdest looking aircraft ever built and get to grips, literally, with the worlds largest hydraulic hand.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: John annoys the Barons and agrees Magna Carta at Runnymede, after a banging rap battle. Meanwhile across the world we meet the formidable Genghis Khan in Mongolia, and catch up with the crafty Saladin during the Crusades.

programme.title: Our Black History Heroes
programme.desc: Nile gets inspired by the achievements of champion long-distance runner Mo Farah.

programme.title: Danny and Mick
programme.desc: Its staff charity cabaret night at the Pottsfield Leisure Centre and special guest and ventriloquist Paul Zerdin is performing. When his sidekick Sam goes missing. Danny and Mick have to step up to perform their own ventriloquist act.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Danny needs a cake for his parents wedding, and fast! The band deliver a cake, but Macs size-shifting machine causes chaos, and they have an angry wedding organiser to contend with.

programme.title: Gladiators: Epic Pranks
programme.desc: Bionic ends up dressed as a rabbit when Nitro pranks him at a fake photoshoot, and the rest of the Gladiators have fun behind the scenes as they prank the audience at Sheffield Arena.

programme.desc: When an underwater tremor separates the Gup-X and its crew, Barnacles seeks guidance from a mysterious sea turtle.

programme.desc: The heroes set out on a quest to find out who is draining colour from the forest and muster all their positivity to save it from greyness.

programme.desc: Steve dives with 100 grey nurse sharks, a wobbegong and a whale shark.

programme.title: Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger the Tricarrotops explores the world of the crunchiest era, going on adventures throughout the colourful Vegesaur Valley.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing sees Coco with a plaster on her finger and of course he wants one too. In the absence of a real plaster, Bing makes one out of sticky tape, but its so sticky that it hurts when he tries to take it off. Bing doesnt want Flop to help so Flop comes up with a new game so that Bing can do it himself.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies bounce on the Tubby Bouncy. Po bounces as high as a cloud, then Laa-Laa bounces higher, Dipsy bounces even higher and Tinky Winky bounces highest of all.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: When Evil Pea poses as a magician so that she can use magic tricks to make the Tato Team disappear, Supertato and Carrot create their own magical plan to rescue them.

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: Live from the Roots and Fruits Theatre, its Strawberry, who used to be insecure, but now cant wait to celebrate herself and sing her song, See the Seeds.

programme.title: Tee and Mo
programme.desc: Tee and Mo build a rocket out of cardboard boxes.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and his friends are making leaf pictures in the woods. They take a piece of paper, place it on a leaf and rub a crayon onto it. They each choose their own leaf, but Bings is whisked away by the wind! Luckily, he manages to catch it.

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Sing along with Orange as she helps Indigo and Violet to colour a rainbow.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels decide they want to be superheroes. Is there anyone that needs their help?

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee and the Squirrels meet a lion with unfortunate breath and teach him a special song to help him learn how to brush his teeth.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: With only five minutes to play `Driving, Bluey and Mum race against the clock to buy milk for a grumpy guest and have to escape an angry shopkeeper.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: The Heelers go on a fun trip to Hammerbarn to get a new pizza oven like their neighbours. At Hammerbarn, Bluey and Bingo play in the gardening section and set up mini-gardens in the trolley.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: After a rainbow appears over the Go Jet Academy, Glitch becomes fascinated with the legend of a pot of gold appearing at the end of it. He tries to create his own, bigger rainbow, ignoring Ubercorns warnings that their ends can never be reached. When he instead causes a huge storm to appear, the Go Jetters must work fast to stop the Academy from flooding.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: When Peter escapes a very chatty Mrs Tiggy-Winkle to go strawberry-raiding, he is surprised to be helped out of trouble by none other than the feisty old hedgehog herself!

programme.title: Octonauts: Above and Beyond
programme.desc: The Octonauts help when they discover melting permafrost endangering an ecosystem.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Three has lost one of her buttons! Can detective Numberblock One help find it?

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: R loves pretending to be a pirate, so she rustles up a ship and takes her crew on a rolling ride through rough seas and rain. Is it all make believe or will she lead them to real treasure?

programme.title: Nick Copes Popcast
programme.desc: Nick, Remie and Alva are growing bean plants, but Normans plant isnt growing. Nick and the Popcasters suggest what Norman needs to do to get his beans back on the scene.

programme.title: Justins House
programme.desc: Justin Fletcher entertains a live audience of children with singing, dancing and comedy chaos. Justin dresses up as Granny Justina when he and Robert forget to invite her round for a special tea party with Katy. Guest starring Katy Ashworth.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing is playing the talking lettuce game on Flops phone when he drops the phone and accidentally breaks it. Too panicked to tell Flop what he has done, Bing puts the phone in the bin but hes so upset that Flop knows something has happened.

programme.title: Yakka Dee
programme.desc: Yakka Dee! celebrates children communicating - because talking fills you up with whizz, pop, bang! In this episode, Dee encourages a friend to say apple and we go on a whirlwind word adventure. We see lots of different apples and explore how they look and taste. We see a green apple, a red apple, a shiny apple and a smiling, bobbing apple. Dee tries a yummy apple in an autumn scene, flies a flying apple and cheers up a crying apple.

programme.title: Lu and the Bally Bunch
programme.desc: While on a boat trip with Gus and his grandad, Lu loses Tara due to her constant rushing.

programme.title: Piggy Builders
programme.desc: Fiona asks the Piggies to help transport her pumpkin to the Vegetable Festival. They agree, not knowing that it is so big, they will have to turn it into a carriage!

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos watch a carpenter at work. While she fetches her toolbox, the Twirlywoos pull the end of the measuring tape across the garden, where they hide in a bush. A tug of war ensues between the Twirlywoos and the carpenter.

programme.title: Something Special: Were All Friends
programme.desc: Justins friend teaches him how to make Indian chapattis as part of a family banquet. Meanwhile, Mr Tumble is preparing a Diwali surprise for the rest of his family.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Tinky Winky, Dipsy, Laa-Laa, and Po play football. The Teletubbies ball goes inside Home Dome, just as the Tubby Phone begins to ring. Its time for a Tubby Phone Dance! The children in Tummy Tales enjoy a football lesson.

programme.title: The Baby Club
programme.desc: Nigel and Baby Bear welcome babies Evie, Gracie, Luke, Hunter, Thea, Benjamin and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Inside everyones bags are different types of toy transport which are explored through discovery, play, song and story. Grown-ups at home are encouraged to take part by hiding safe, baby appropriate toy vehicles inside a fabric bag or pillowcase for them to reveal and explore with their baby!

programme.title: I Spy, You Spy
programme.desc: Elsee plays I Spy next to a beautiful lake with her new friend Olivia.

programme.title: Maddie and Triggs
programme.desc: Its bath time, and Maddie and Triggs embark on a bubble-tastic submarine adventure to the bottom of the ocean in search of Triggs favourite bath toy, Denis the Ducky.

programme.title: Dylans Playtime Adventures
programme.desc: Dylan the mail carrier wants to deliver all the mail, but when one of the addresses becomes unreadable, hes going to have to do some extra leg work.

programme.title: Kiri and Lou
programme.desc: Kiri, Lou and Sorry are playing tickle monster. They are very surprised when the grumpy Ichtheo wants to join in, but he turns out to be the best monster of all.

programme.title: Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger the Tricarrotops explores the world of the crunchiest era, going on adventures throughout the colourful Vegesaur Valley.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo test the limits of Dads patience, when they become restless while waiting for their takeaway order.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Happy notices a tiny fruit fly on his apple and the Squirrels are amazed by how small it is. The fly reveals there are many things even smaller than him and Duggee teaches them that some things are so small that you cant even see them, like atoms.

programme.title: The Game Catchers
programme.desc: The Catchers land on a planet populated by aliens made of different coloured stones, piled on top of each other, whose favourite game is Wolf Eats Fruit.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Deepavali Fireworks
programme.desc: Nikhil, Jay and their family celebrate Deepavali, also known as Diwali, with kolam, laddus and bunting. They try to watch the fireworks without scaring Max the cat.

programme.title: My First Festivals
programme.desc: Follow Deeya as she celebrates Diwali, the Hindu festival of light. Deeya begins by going to the park with her mum, where she learns how the colours and lights represent the festival. After shopping for something to wear for their big Diwali party, Deeya finds the perfect dress and heads back home. There, she helps her great-grandma to cook some delicious, authentic Indian snacks and decorate the house with lots of lights.

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Talented young chef Ben is cooking German zwiebelkuchen. Bens parents are German, and zwiebelkuchen is a very popular recipe in Germany. It is one of Bens favourite foods, so he is very happy to teach us all to make it. Zwiebelkuchen is an onion tart that is made from pastry, onions and German ham. Ben is adding lots of extra flavour by using caraway seeds.

programme.title: Postman Pat: Special Delivery Service
programme.sub-title: Postman Pat and the Twinkly Lights
programme.desc: Its Diwali and Nisha is trying to decorate the cafe with special fairy lights to celebrate. Pat delivers them first thing! But the lights break straight away, and then they realise that the electricity in the cafe is also broken!

programme.title: Whats in Your Bag?
programme.desc: Bharatanatyam dancer Suhani tells us all about her ghungroo, or anklet, and why she loves to wear it.

programme.title: Time for School
programme.desc: Its Diwali, and the class has visitors who have come to tell them about the meaning behind the festival of light. The children have a go at making rangoli with Mrs Hussain and try some tasty Indian sweets. Jessica, Theo and Alba are creating some diya lamps out of clay with the help of Miss Gerrard and some hungry crocodiles! The lamps are part of a special display, and the class celebrate all they have learnt.

programme.title: Graces Amazing Machines
programme.desc: Motorbike rider Grace shows off three incredible machines that are all designed to move quickly. Grace drives a very expensive supercar, shows off the fantastic Concorde and rides a superbike around her track.

programme.title: Yakka Dee
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say `drum and we go on a whirlwind word adventure. We see and hear lots of different drums - a loud drum, a marching drum, a tap it drum and a whack it drum! We all have a dance to a steel drum, see a tiny mouse playing a rum pum drum and enjoy Dee playing a set of drums at a big concert.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Sing along to the Numberblocks counting song with the Numberblocks favourite friends. Learn to count to ten with the Numberblocks.

programme.title: Wonderblocks
programme.desc: Cow, Sheep and Secret Agent Chicken take part in a musical contest.

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: All the Colourblocks come together for a big song. Learn different colours and colour mixes with the Colourblocks.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: When the Squirrels cant figure out if fish have noses, Duggee shows them his library. But when the Squirrels realise no-one is visiting it, they have an idea. A mobile library. The Squirrels set off with Duggee. Along the way, they help Tino find his creativity, King Tiger figure out his favourite ice cream flavour and Worm find her love of fantasy. The Squirrels learn just how helpful and informative a library can be.

programme.title: Yukee
programme.desc: Yukees garden friends help turn her a day in my life homework assignment into an exciting, musical sound adventure.

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin and his friends go on a fruit picking adventure. Meanwhile, Aunt Polly judges the annual Fabulous Fruit Competition, but what has Mr Tumble done to Grandads strawberries?

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies accidentally leave the Tiddlytubbies gate open, and some of them escape into Home Dome. The Teletubbies must find them all and then close the gate.

programme.title: Andys Safari Adventures
programme.desc: Andy jets off in his safari-mobile to Africa in search of a tiny elephant shrew.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Miss Berrington, Evies new school teacher, and teaching assistant Mr ODonnell have come to meet Evie at home before term starts, and Waffle is under strict instructions to be on his best behaviour. But Waffle is teething and wont stop chewing everything in sight.

programme.title: Molly and Mack
programme.desc: Molly examines her shelf of special things at the back of Macks stall. She chooses the pottery tile and remembers the day she got it. Molly meets a new stall owner, Alice, and shows her round the Big Hub. While Molly takes Alice for a drink in the Wobbly Coffee Pot, James and Mack bring Alices boxes in to set up the stall, but James drops one of the boxes, smashing some of her pottery.

programme.title: Raa Raa the Noisy Lion
programme.desc: Raa Raa is playing a game, copying everyone in the jungle. He soon distracts his friends, but can he put the game to good use?

programme.title: The Game Catchers
programme.desc: The Game Catchers land on an ancient Greek planet to play jump the rubber band.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: When an underwater storm destroys a small reef, which a frogfish and other creatures depend on, Tweak and her crewmates must convert the Gup-F into an artificial reef before another storm strikes!

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale of the Cat and the Rat
programme.desc: When Jemima and the ducklings are driven from their coop by Sammy Whiskers, Peter must enlist the unwitting help of Mr. McGregors Cat to get her home back.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee is having a cup of tea in his favourite cup when Roly surprises him with a very loud PEEK-A-BOO! It is so loud that Duggee jumps and drops his cup which shatters into pieces. Time for a bit of pottery.

programme.title: Vida the Vet
programme.desc: When Fergie is feeling off, Vida diagnoses her as suffering from a sad day. It happens to everyone, and all she needs to do is take care of herself. Luckily, she has lots of friends to help out.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertato and Carrot are in a race to find treasure before Captain Pak Choi does.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Whilst Dad is stuck in the desert, D.O.R.I.S. tries to give Cosima and Big Lizard a lesson on friction. As things begin to heat up, a creature steals Cosimas only means to locate Dad!

programme.title: Mojo Swoptops
programme.desc: Fabios yummy new sauce is so sticky that he gets stuck to Mojos bonnet. They have to do everything together until Bo figures out how to unsticky that sauce!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: With only five minutes to play `Driving, Bluey and Mum race against the clock to buy milk for a grumpy guest and have to escape an angry shopkeeper.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: The Heelers go on a fun trip to Hammerbarn to get a new pizza oven like their neighbours. At Hammerbarn, Bluey and Bingo play in the gardening section and set up mini-gardens in the trolley.

programme.title: Piripenguins
programme.desc: Flutter helps Brinicle with his brioche baking, but it leaves the Piris with a problem.

programme.title: Dodges Pup School
programme.desc: Its the first day of Pup School. Dodge overcomes his first day nerves as he meets lots of new friends. The pups settle into their class activities with their new teacher Miss Collie.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Its the hottest day of the year and Waffle is eating ice cream to cool down. Outside in the sweltering heat, Simon turns on the sprinkler to help everyone cool down, but poor Waffle doesnt like the sprinkler and darts through the hole in the fence to Mrs Hobbss garden, looking for shade. The Brooklyn-Bells try to coax him back, but he refuses to return. Doug decides to make a mini swimming pool by filling the ball pit with cool water. Waffle loves swimming pools.

programme.title: Puffin Rock
programme.desc: Phoenix eagerly joins in some Puffin Practice with Oona, Isabelle and Baba but doubts himself when he cant do everything they can.

programme.title: JoJo and Gran Gran
programme.sub-title: Autumn: Its Time to Celebrate Diwali
programme.desc: JoJo and Gran Gran celebrate Diwali, the festival of light, with their friends Raya and Nirada. Its a very exciting celebration, with lots of yummy food, diyas, music and, of course, lights. Raya teaches JoJo how to make a rangoli. And when Raya doesnt like the loud sounds coming from the fireworks, JoJo has a plan to help her friend.

programme.title: Moon and Me
programme.desc: The discovery of a nursery rhyme book in the Toy House inspires Mr Onion to play at being Humpty Dumpty. When Humpty Onion refuses to fall off the wall, all the Toy House friends join in a game to make a comical new ending to the Humpty rhyme.

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: Tiny Clanger has made up a lovely new tune to play with her singing flower friends. Mother Clanger thinks Tiny is very talented, but when Tiny suggests Mother should have a go, she gets very flustered and rushes off to her garden. But Major Clanger has a plan - and soon there is the sound of lovely music coming from the garden. Who can possibly be playing?

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: After having their faces washed by Makka Pakka, the Pontipines go to meet the Wottingers, but the Wottingers are not in. Where could they be? The Pontipines go looking for them around the garden.

programme.title: Cbeebies Bedtime Stories
programme.desc: An exciting story read by a special guest. Annette reads `Katinkas Tail by Judith Kerr, a story about a pussycat with an extraordinary tail.

programme.title: Paheli
programme.desc: Kishanlal marries the beautiful Lachchi, but the day after the wedding, he leaves on business for five years. When Kishanlal reappears only a few days later, Lachchi is delighted, but this new Kishanlal is in fact a spirit who has taken the form of Lachchis husband, after having seen her by chance and fallen in love with her. Four years later, the real Kishanlal returns and the townsfolk must determine who is who.

programme.title: Bhagam Bhaag

programme.desc: Marie treats the family to a holiday in Rome, but Rays not happy.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: The family are still on holiday in Rome, where Robert has fallen for a stunning Italian beauty, who happens to work in an ice cream shop.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray finally snaps when Marie drives her car into his house.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Torn between his girlfriend Amy, ex-wife Joanne and Italian bombshell Stefania, Robert foolishly decides to tell Amy he met up with Joanne. Amy runs for support from Debra, who accidentally tells her about Stefania.

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: Stuart lobbies to become Carters new roommate; James tries to protect a rat that is on the loose in Mikes office.

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: Mike promises to coordinate Paul and Claudias wedding, but he discovers the church is booked for a funeral.

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: Mike is hailed a hero when he saves a runaway baby carriage in Central Park. Carter takes in his family dog and model Heidi Klum.

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: Mike dates model Heidi Klum and ends up on the front page of the papers, and Nikki thinks she has feelings for Mike.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: On Thanksgiving, the friends form teams and play American football. Ross and Monica relive their sibling rivalry by going head-to-head as opposing team captains. Rachel is upset that Ross didnt choose her for his team, and Joey tries to outwit his foe Chandler. Meanwhile, the turkey is left stewing while the losing team calls for a rematch.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Rachel wonders if shell ever get another job after she quits Central Perk, Joeys new job selling Christmas trees upsets Phoebe, and Ross accidentally breaks a little girls leg.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Chandler Cant Remember Which Sister
programme.desc: Ross is suspicious about Rachels possible job offer from a good-looking stranger, while Chandler cant remember which of Joeys many attractive sisters he kissed at a party.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With All the Jealousy
programme.desc: Ross becomes increasingly jealous of Rachels sexy new colleague, Mark, and gets the wrong end of the stick when he spies on Rachel at her office. Meanwhile, Monica is enamoured with a sexy busboy who writes love poems for her, and Joey gets himself into trouble by faking his CV in order to get a part in a Broadway musical.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Monica and Richard Are Just Friends
programme.desc: Monica bumps into Richard in a video store and they decide to work on their friendship, but the more time they spend together, the more sexual their relationship becomes. Meanwhile, Phoebe dates an athlete who unintentionally keeps exposing himself by wearing loose shorts, and Rachel agrees to read `The Shining if Joey will read `Little Women.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe is reunited with her former singing partner, Leslie, a failed television commercial jingle writer who wants to use Phoebes signature song `Smelly Cat in an advertisement for cat litter. Meanwhile, Ross becomes jealous when Rachel agrees to go to a fashion lecture with Mark, a former colleague who has just left for a new job, and Chandler meets a beautiful woman, Ginger, who has a prosthetic leg.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross and Rachel Take a Break
programme.desc: Rachels job prevents her from celebrating her anniversary with Ross. Wanting more time to focus on her new job, she suggests the two take a break from their relationship. Convinced that Rachel has dumped him for one of her workmates, Ross hooks up with a woman from the copy shop that Joey and Chandler have been after.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross tries to prevent Rachel from learning his disturbing secret. Meanwhile, Monica, Phoebe, Chandler and Joey spend a night eavesdropping.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Without the Ski Trip
programme.desc: Ross and Rachel have been fighting for the groups attention since the break up. Rachel invites everyone except Ross to her family cabin in the mountains, but on the way to the cabin, they run out of petrol. Everyone wants to call Ross for help, but Rachel wont let them.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Hypnosis Tape
programme.desc: Phoebe is upset when her 18-year-old half-brother, Frank Jr, wants to marry his attractive home economics teacher, who is more than 25 years older than him. Elsewhere, Monica receives a tip from an admirer worth a small fortune, and a hypnosis tape intended to assist Chandler give up smoking has a rather strange effect on him.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Tiny T-Shirt
programme.desc: Rachels former colleague Mark asks her out on a date. When Rachel invites Ross to her apartment, he thinks she wants to get back together, but she just wants to return his things. Later, as Rachel and Mark return from their date, Ross spies on them through the peephole of Joey and Chandlers door. Meanwhile, Monica dates a millionaire, and Joey is cast in a play and clashes with the female lead.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica inherits a beautiful dollhouse that is too elaborate to play with, so Phoebe makes her own, but it meets a sad end. Meanwhile, Joey thinks hes found his true love, and Rachels boss dates Chandler, placing her in a dangerous situation.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With a Chick and a Duck
programme.desc: When Monicas millionaire friend Pete buys a restaurant and asks Monica to be the head chef, she is faced with a difficult decision. Meanwhile, Ross makes a sacrifice for Rachel, and Joey buys Chandler an unusual pet.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The friends go to the opening night of one of Joeys plays. When Rachel finds out that Ross is bringing a date, she finds one of her own. Ross tries to convince Rachel that her date is mentally unbalanced. Meanwhile, Joeys play gets terrible reviews, but his co-star provides some comfort.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross develops a skin growth that doctors cant identify.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Ultimate Fighting Champion
programme.desc: Monica finds herself dating a guy who wants to be the Ultimate Fighting Champion. Meanwhile, Chandler finds his male bosss attentions just a little too friendly, and the group overhear a scandalous conversation at Central Perk.

programme.title: Iain Stirlings Roast The Internet
programme.sub-title: Jamali Maddix, London Hughes, Josh Jones and Celya AB
programme.desc: Iain is joined by Jamali Maddix, London Hughes, Josh Jones and Celya AB for a no-holds-barred roast of viral chaos and online absurdity.

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: Brad and Barney kickstart this leg of their tour with a bang - in honour of the famous Swede, Alfred Nobel. They then hit the ice and go head to head in a curling competition alongside the Swedish Womens Team in Stockholm. Barney treats his dad to an infamous fishy delicacy for breakfast, then takes him paintballing - with a Western twist! Before leaving the country, Barney treats ABBA mega fan Brad to the ultimate musical surprise.

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: In the final leg of Brad and Barneys epic journey, the pair experience a bitterly cold Norway. The boys head to Lillehammer and try out the Olympic bobsleigh track before heading further north to the Arctic Circle and the worlds most northerly surfing location.

programme.title: Utopia
programme.desc: Set inside the offices of the Nation Building Authority, a newly created government organisation responsible for overseeing major infrastructure projects, Utopia explores that moment when bureaucracy and grand dreams collide.

programme.sub-title: The One With the Hypnosis Tape
programme.desc: Phoebe is upset when her 18-year-old half-brother, Frank Jr, wants to marry his attractive home economics teacher, who is more than 25 years older than him. Elsewhere, Monica receives a tip from an admirer worth a small fortune, and a hypnosis tape intended to assist Chandler give up smoking has a rather strange effect on him.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Tiny T-Shirt
programme.desc: Rachels former colleague Mark asks her out on a date. When Rachel invites Ross to her apartment, he thinks she wants to get back together, but she just wants to return his things. Later, as Rachel and Mark return from their date, Ross spies on them through the peephole of Joey and Chandlers door. Meanwhile, Monica dates a millionaire, and Joey is cast in a play and clashes with the female lead.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica inherits a beautiful dollhouse that is too elaborate to play with, so Phoebe makes her own, but it meets a sad end. Meanwhile, Joey thinks hes found his true love, and Rachels boss dates Chandler, placing her in a dangerous situation.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With a Chick and a Duck
programme.desc: When Monicas millionaire friend Pete buys a restaurant and asks Monica to be the head chef, she is faced with a difficult decision. Meanwhile, Ross makes a sacrifice for Rachel, and Joey buys Chandler an unusual pet.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The friends go to the opening night of one of Joeys plays. When Rachel finds out that Ross is bringing a date, she finds one of her own. Ross tries to convince Rachel that her date is mentally unbalanced. Meanwhile, Joeys play gets terrible reviews, but his co-star provides some comfort.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross develops a skin growth that doctors cant identify.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Ultimate Fighting Champion
programme.desc: Monica finds herself dating a guy who wants to be the Ultimate Fighting Champion. Meanwhile, Chandler finds his male bosss attentions just a little too friendly, and the group overhear a scandalous conversation at Central Perk.

programme.title: Iain Stirlings Roast The Internet
programme.sub-title: Jamali Maddix, London Hughes, Josh Jones and Celya AB
programme.desc: Iain is joined by Jamali Maddix, London Hughes, Josh Jones and Celya AB for a no-holds-barred roast of viral chaos and online absurdity.

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: Brad and Barney kickstart this leg of their tour with a bang - in honour of the famous Swede, Alfred Nobel. They then hit the ice and go head to head in a curling competition alongside the Swedish Womens Team in Stockholm. Barney treats his dad to an infamous fishy delicacy for breakfast, then takes him paintballing - with a Western twist! Before leaving the country, Barney treats ABBA mega fan Brad to the ultimate musical surprise.

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: In the final leg of Brad and Barneys epic journey, the pair experience a bitterly cold Norway. The boys head to Lillehammer and try out the Olympic bobsleigh track before heading further north to the Arctic Circle and the worlds most northerly surfing location.

programme.title: Utopia
programme.desc: Set inside the offices of the Nation Building Authority, a newly created government organisation responsible for overseeing major infrastructure projects, Utopia explores that moment when bureaucracy and grand dreams collide.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: The boys are back in Alaska (although Discovery dropped the states mention in the title after the first season) hoping to strike it rich mining for gold. Their first effort was anything but rich and glorious, however, as the crew led by Todd Hoffman and his father, Jack, sunk $250,000 into their dream and came away with just $20,000 worth of gold. The dismal summer was filled with injuries, malfunctioning equipment and constant fighting among the greenhorn miners, yet their serious case of gold fever trumps any talk of giving up and leads to a new operating plan in order to salvage their dream. The series also keeps tabs on the efforts of teenager Parker Schnabel and old-timer Dakota Fred to hit the mother lode at separate sites.

programme.sub-title: Work in 600-Degree Heat; Make Champagne; Expand Ports
programme.desc: How do they make the cool clothing that can withstand the heat of a blast furnace, how is sea turned into land to create an artificial island and how is the fizz put into Champagne?

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.sub-title: Manufacture Propellers; Intelligent Cars; Turning Metal Into Magnets
programme.desc: Discover how a car that can call emergency services was designed, how to turn metal into magnets and how the biggest ships are propelled.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Find out how they look after sharks at the worlds biggest aquarium, how to grow precious stones and what it takes to build a luxury Bentley.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: The team cant wait to get their hands on a Volvo P1800 but the problem is, these cars are rare and Mike can only find a single car thats in budget. Will it be good enough?

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike finds a clean WRX at a good price. Mike decides to make it stand out by making it go faster and look better. Edd has plenty of ideas on how to do both.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: The boys rummage through the hanger of a Vulcan bomber. Henry restores a cockpit seat and Simon attempts to turn part of a jet engine into a coffee table.

programme.title: Fantasy Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: Occupational therapists living in North London want to move to the coastal town of Broadstairs as they, along with their two young boys, are fast outgrowing their current home.

programme.title: Fantasy Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: A Warrington couple want to move to the Conwy area of North Wales, where they have been holidaying for the past five years. They are also looking for a property with the wow-factor.

programme.title: Fantasy Homes by the Sea

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew visits some family-run businesses in Lincolnshire, Norfolk and Grimsby in the hope of finding rare and unusual antiques that have never been put on sale before.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton is in the Cotswolds on an unusual house-hunting mission with a couple whose £900,000 budget needs to fund two separate homes under one roof. Whilst there, Alistair visits a lavender farm in full bloom.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton is property hunting in North Devon with a couple whose search for a country home on a £325,000 budget has so far fallen short. Plus, Alistair learns about a unique local pigment, known as `Bideford Black, and enjoys the artistic freedom of painting on the beach.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and special objects - the bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore is in East Lothian, determined to save quality items from ending up on the scrapheap at Wallyford Recycling Centre. Antiques restorer Peter Fournel tries to breathe new life into an Edwardian chair, designer Daniel Heath has a drop-leaf table to update, and Sarah has a collection of woollen blankets to get creative with.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: A new road trip, a new classic car and a brand new expert: dealer and auctioneer Mark Hill joins veteran antique-seeker Roo Irvine on a hunt for collectables and curios around Scotland. Mark goes about parting with his £200 kitty with gusto, buying 1940s ceramics, a ship in a dome and a 1920s French fountain pen that really is something to write home about. However, one discovery he secures for a bargain price proves to be a canny investment when it soars at auction.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

programme.desc: There are shocking revelations for a man who was left as a baby on church steps over 50 years ago, when a long-held family secret is finally uncovered. programme.title: Long Lost Family

programme.title: Long Lost Family

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Presents
programme.desc: Judgement day approaches for an innocent man (Brian Keith) who is facing the gas chamber for murder. With James Westerfield.

programme.title: The Green Hornet
programme.desc: The heir to a newspaper fortune joins forces with a resourceful company employee to try to bring a powerful Los Angeles crime lord to justice.

programme.title: Twilight of the Warriors: Walled In
programme.desc: The notorious Kowloon Walled City serves as a fortified, lawless safe haven for gangs and refugees alike. But when a skilled underground fighter runs afoul of the most feared Triad boss in Hong Kong.

programme.title: The Dark Tower
programme.desc: Roland Deschain, the last Gunslinger, must prevent the Man in Black from toppling the Dark Tower, the key that holds the universe together.

programme.title: Man of Steel
programme.desc: Though struggling with the ramifications of his extraordinary origin and abilities, young Clark Kent must become a hero and save those he loves from a dire threat.

programme.title: The Bricklayer
programme.desc: A rogue insurgent assassinates foreign journalists and makes it look like the CIA is responsible. Coaxed out of retirement to clear the agencys name, a deadly operative must confront his checkered past while unraveling an international conspiracy.

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: In the late 21st century, a factory worker visits a company that implants fake memories. However, after his procedure he struggles to tell real and fabricated thoughts apart.

programme.title: Venom: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Eddie Brock and Venom must make a devastating decision as theyre pursued by a mysterious military man and alien monsters from Venoms home world.

programme.title: The Scorpion King
programme.desc: In a time before the pyramids, an evil king threatens to take over the world, so the leaders of the remaining tribes under threat call upon a desert warrior to help them defeat the wicked one and his brutal hordes. As the warrior battles against the evil around him, he is preparing for a final showdown that will decide if it is to be his destiny to become the great Scorpion King.

programme.title: Superman Returns
programme.desc: The Man of Steel returns to Earth after a five-year absence to find Lex Luthor ready to take over the world, and Lois Lane shacked up with a new man and a kid. The people have lost faith in their former saviour. Can Superman save their lives and regain their trust?

Stylish historical epic retelling the fierce battle at Thermopylae in 481BC. The Spartan king, Leonidas, and his tiny army of 300 followers provided inspiration for the whole of Greece as they fought the massed ranks of the Persian army whose commander, King Xerxes, had up to a million warriors at his disposal.

programme.title: Superman IV: The Quest for Peace
programme.desc: World leaders want Superman to intervene in the arms race, but he is caught in a dilemma - having vowed never to interfere in history. He eventually agrees to destroy all nuclear weapons, but then comes face to face with the android Protean Man, Lex Luthors latest evil creation. Luthor wants to stoke up the arms race, and sees the android - made from Kryptonite - as the only way to stop Superman.

programme.title: The Dark Tower
programme.desc: Roland Deschain, the last Gunslinger, must prevent the Man in Black from toppling the Dark Tower, the key that holds the universe together.

programme.title: William Tell
programme.desc: In 14th Century Switzerland, a once peaceful hunter leads his people in rebellion after his family and country are threatened by a tyrannical Austrian King. As the Holy Roman Empire crumbles, the quiet lives of the Swiss peasants are upended.

programme.title: The Bricklayer

programme.desc: A down-on-her-luck actress accepts an offer to star in a film shot on a mysterious island. While there, the actress is abducted by natives who offer her as a sacrifice to a giant ape, which instead of harming the starlet becomes smitten with her. The crew manage to capture the ape and bring it back to Manhattan to exhibit as a showpiece. However, on the shows opening night, things go horribly wrong.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: Dracula, who operates a high-end resort away from the human world, goes into overprotective mode when a boy discovers the resort and falls for the counts teen-aged daughter.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 2
programme.desc: Concerned that his half-human grandson isnt showing his vampire side, Dracula and his friends put the boy through a `monster-in-training boot camp just as Dracs old-school father decides to pay a visit.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 3: A Monster Vacation
programme.desc: Mavis surprises Dracula with plans for a fun-filled summer voyage on a monster cruise. As the pack starts enjoying colossal buffets and exotic excursions, Drac finds himself falling for the ships intriguing but dangerous captain. He soon learns that trying to balance family, friends and romance might just be too much to handle. even for the worlds most powerful vampire.

programme.title: The Wild Thornberrys Movie
programme.desc: A feature-length spin-off from the TV series, the Thornberry family - led by natural history film-maker Colonel Radcliff Thornberry - head to deepest Africa. Once there, daughter Eliza - after meeting a shaman - can talk to the animals, a skill that stands her in good stead to foil a dastardly plot by poachers to kill a herd of elephants for their ivory.

programme.title: Dragon Rider
programme.desc: A dragon, an orphaned boy, and a mountain spirit work together as they trek through the Himalayas in search for the Rim of Heaven.

programme.title: Barnyard
programme.desc: Otis the cow is a wild-living party animal and just loves to dance until dawn, but then his dad is killed by coyotes, and Otis has to become the responsible leader of the rest of the all-singing, all-dancing farm animals.

programme.title: Monster Family
programme.desc: Draculas spell turns a woman and her loved ones into a vampire, a mummy, a werewolf and Frankensteins monster.

programme.desc: A family of ducks decides to leave the safety of a New England pond for an adventurous trip to Jamaica. However, their well-laid plans quickly go awry when they get lost and wind up in New York City.

programme.desc: A snail gets the chance to escape his slow-paced life and race in the Indianapolis 500 when a freak accident gives him the power of superspeed.

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: Scott Pilgrim plays bass guitar in a struggling Toronto-based band and pines after his ex-girlfriend, now a success in her own band. At a party he meets Ramona Flowers and instantly is smitten, but in his pursuit of her he is attacked by Matthew Patel who informs Scott that he is the first of seven evil exes that Scott will have to defeat in order to win Ramona.

programme.title: Twins
programme.desc: Two very different twin brothers were born as a result of a genetic experiment. Following their birth, the flawless Julius grew up on a paradise island, while the less-than-perfect Vincent was sent to an orphanage. Now, many years later, Vincent is a thief and con man with huge debts. What will Julius think when he searches for his long-lost twin and finds him in jail?

programme.title: Nutty Professor II: The Klumps
programme.desc: Sherman is getting married to Denise Gains but his alter-ego Buddy Love keeps breaking through. Determined to rid himself of his pesky partner, he extracts Buddys genes, but an accident and a dog hair see Buddy take on his own life. Unaware of his existence, Sherman and Denise perfect their new rejuvenation formula and their fortune seems assured until Buddy steals it.

programme.title: Parenthood
programme.desc: An over-protective dad, determined to do a better job than his own distant father, anxiously dotes on his troubled eight-year-old son. His brother, meanwhile, strives to mould his toddler daughter into an academic high-flyer, and his sister struggles with two rebellious, angst-ridden teenagers.

programme.title: Dumb and Dumber To
programme.desc: Twenty years after their last adventure, good-hearted, yet dimwitted best friends, Harry Dunne and Lloyd Christmas head out in search for Harrys long lost daughter, and Lloyds in love again.

programme.title: Nacho Libre
programme.desc: Brother Ignacio is an orphanage chef who cooks up a plan to earn money for the kids by becoming a Mexican wrestling star. First, he must don a leotard.

programme.title: Bean: The Ultimate Disaster Movie
programme.desc: Mr Bean has somehow managed to get a job as a security guard. His latest assignment finds him travelling to America as an art expert, looking after the famous `Whistlers Mother painting as it is transported from Britain to a posh new Los Angeles museum. The catch is that Bean is no art expert and his trip was a ploy by his British employers to get rid of him. Unfortunately, no one has warned the Americans about Mr Bean.

programme.title: Mr Beans Holiday
programme.desc: Mr Bean is going on holiday to the south of France, looking for a quiet and sunny trip in the Riviera. However, his trip doesnt go as smoothly as he expected when he has to face a series of misunderstandings and totally unfortunate coincidences. Eventually, Mr Bean will end up spoiling the last film of the snobbish director Carson Clay and appearing by accident at the Cannes Film Festival.

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: When a criminal plot endangers the beach, Mitch Buchannon leads his elite squad of lifeguards on a mission to prove that one doesnt need to wear a badge to save the bay.

programme.title: Crazy Rich Asians
programme.desc: Rachel Chu is happy to accompany her longtime boyfriend, Nick, to his best friends wedding in Singapore. Shes also surprised to learn that Nicks family is extremely wealthy and hes considered one of the countrys most eligible bachelors. Thrust into the spotlight, Rachel must now contend with jealous socialites, quirky relatives and something far, far worse: Nicks disapproving mother.

programme.title: Horrible Bosses
programme.desc: Nick, Dale and Kurt all despise their bosses, but who would be crazy enough to quit their jobs in such poor economic times? The trio drunkenly and hypothetically discuss how to kill their bosses, and before they know it, theyve hired a murder consultant to help them pull off the three deeds.

programme.title: Pixels
programme.desc: Video game experts are recruited by the military to fight 1980s-era video game characters whove attacked New York.

programme.title: Kangaroo Jack
programme.desc: Two childhood friends get caught up in with the mob in New York and find themselves forced to travel to Australia to deliver $50,000. Their trouble really starts when they reach the outback, and a kangaroo bounds away with the cash.

programme.title: Bad Teacher
programme.desc: A rude, drug-abusing educator vies with a perky colleague for the attentions of a rich and handsome substitute teacher.

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: Scott Pilgrim plays bass guitar in a struggling Toronto-based band and pines after his ex-girlfriend, now a success in her own band. At a party he meets Ramona Flowers and instantly is smitten, but in his pursuit of her he is attacked by Matthew Patel who informs Scott that he is the first of seven evil exes that Scott will have to defeat in order to win Ramona.

programme.title: Twins
programme.desc: Two very different twin brothers were born as a result of a genetic experiment. Following their birth, the flawless Julius grew up on a paradise island, while the less-than-perfect Vincent was sent to an orphanage. Now, many years later, Vincent is a thief and con man with huge debts. What will Julius think when he searches for his long-lost twin and finds him in jail?

programme.title: Nutty Professor II: The Klumps
programme.desc: Sherman is getting married to Denise Gains but his alter-ego Buddy Love keeps breaking through. Determined to rid himself of his pesky partner, he extracts Buddys genes, but an accident and a dog hair see Buddy take on his own life. Unaware of his existence, Sherman and Denise perfect their new rejuvenation formula and their fortune seems assured until Buddy steals it.

programme.title: Parenthood
programme.desc: An over-protective dad, determined to do a better job than his own distant father, anxiously dotes on his troubled eight-year-old son. His brother, meanwhile, strives to mould his toddler daughter into an academic high-flyer, and his sister struggles with two rebellious, angst-ridden teenagers.

programme.title: Dumb and Dumber To
programme.desc: Twenty years after their last adventure, good-hearted, yet dimwitted best friends, Harry Dunne and Lloyd Christmas head out in search for Harrys long lost daughter, and Lloyds in love again.

programme.title: Nacho Libre
programme.desc: Brother Ignacio is an orphanage chef who cooks up a plan to earn money for the kids by becoming a Mexican wrestling star. First, he must don a leotard.

programme.title: Bean: The Ultimate Disaster Movie

programme.title: Pixels
programme.desc: Video game experts are recruited by the military to fight 1980s-era video game characters whove attacked New York.

programme.title: Kangaroo Jack
programme.desc: Two childhood friends get caught up in with the mob in New York and find themselves forced to travel to Australia to deliver $50,000. Their trouble really starts when they reach the outback, and a kangaroo bounds away with the cash.

programme.title: Bad Teacher
programme.desc: A rude, drug-abusing educator vies with a perky colleague for the attentions of a rich and handsome substitute teacher.

programme.title: Flashdance
programme.desc: A young female welder dreams of becoming a professional dancer and struggles against all the odds to realise her dream. However, in her effort to succeed, she discovers that getting to the top is far from easy. Giorgio Moroders composition `Flashdance (What a Feeling), sung by Irene Cara, won an Academy Award for Best Original Song.

programme.title: There Will Be Blood
programme.desc: Ruthless silver miner, turned oil prospector, Daniel Plainview moves to oil-rich California. Using his adopted son HW to project a trustworthy, family-man image, Plainview cons local landowners into selling him their valuable properties for a pittance. However, local preacher Eli Sunday suspects Plainviews motives and intentions, starting a slow-burning feud that threatens both their lives.

programme.title: A League of Their Own
programme.desc: Based on a true story, this film, set during World War II, tells the story of the all-female baseball league that was started while the American men were away fighting in Europe. After a team of potential players has been recruited, former player Jimmy Dugan coaches the girls and prepares them for the World Series.

programme.title: Birdy
programme.desc: A soldier returns from Vietnam to find his boyhood friend, also a fellow soldier, in a military hospital, having suffered a mental breakdown in which he has become detached from reality and imagines that he is a bird.

programme.title: Scent of a Woman
programme.desc: Frank is a retired Lt Col in the US army. Hes blind and impossible to get along with. Charlie is at school and is looking forward to going to university; to help pay for a trip home for Christmas, he agrees to look after Frank over thanksgiving. Franks niece says this will be easy money, but she didnt reckon on Frank spending his Thanksgiving in New York.

programme.title: The Kings Speech
programme.desc: Afflicted with a stammer, Prince Albert, the Duke of York, dreads the speaking engagements that come with being the son of King George V.

programme.title: P.S. I Love You
programme.desc: New York widow Holly is devastated by her husbands sudden demise, but messages he left behind offer a ray of hope.

programme.title: Bob Marley: One Love
programme.desc: Jamaican singer-songwriter Bob Marley overcomes adversity to become the most famous reggae musician in the world.

programme.title: Dreamgirls
programme.desc: Following the adventures of The Dreamettes, an all-girl singing group. Theyre going nowhere fast until they meet fast-talking car salesman-come-manager who has ambitions to make a fortune selling black music to a white audience. He persuades them to become backing singers for James `Thunder Early, but the larger-than-life lead singer Effie White must step out of the spotlight in favour of the more image-friendly Deena Jones.

programme.title: Champion
programme.desc: Midge Kelly steps into the ring to defend his world title and then tells his rise to fame through flashback. A drifter with his brother Connie, his only way out of the poverty of the Depression is to climb into the ring, under the guidance of trainer Tommy Haley. As he rises to the top, he tramples on everyone whos helped him, from Haley to his first wife Emma.

programme.title: The Brutalist
programme.desc: Escaping postwar Europe, a visionary architect comes to America to rebuild his life, his career, and his marriage. On his own in a strange new country, he settles in Pennsylvania, where a wealthy and prominent industrialist recognises his talent.

programme.title: The Brutalist
programme.desc: Escaping postwar Europe, a visionary architect comes to America to rebuild his life, his career, and his marriage. On his own in a strange new country, he settles in Pennsylvania, where a wealthy and prominent industrialist recognises his talent.

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
programme.desc: Harry, Ron and Hermione have escaped Bellatrix Lestranges clutches, but their getaway has come at a price. Dobby has been killed, meanwhile Lord Voldemort has acquired the highly powerful Elder Wand from Dumbledores tomb. Still on a quest to destroy the Horcruxes that hold the pieces of Voldemorts soul, Harry breaks into Bellatrix vault, where he finds a Horcrux.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Magical Movies
programme.desc: From Harry Potter to Fantastic Beasts, Ella Enchanted to The Secret Garden. Discover a collection of magical journeys where destiny and wonder collide.

programme.title: Small Soldiers
programme.desc: A toy company develops action-figure soldiers whose realistic fighting capabilities cause mayhem for a toy-shop owner and his family. Unaware of their military prowess, the shop keeper takes delivery of the soldiers, who break free from their packaging to attack their Gorgonite enemies. When the Gorgonites communicate with the shop keepers son, the humans find themselves under siege.

programme.title: Mr Beans Holiday
programme.desc: Mr Bean is going on holiday to the south of France, looking for a quiet and sunny trip in the Riviera. However, his trip doesnt go as smoothly as he expected when he has to face a series of misunderstandings and totally unfortunate coincidences. Eventually, Mr Bean will end up spoiling the last film of the snobbish director Carson Clay and appearing by accident at the Cannes Film Festival.

programme.title: Save The Cinema
programme.desc: Sky Original film following Welsh hairdresser Liz Evans fight to save her small towns theatre. Poignant British drama based on a true story starring Samantha Morton.

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: Its London in 1904, and writer JM Barrie is inspired by a family he meets, mother Sylvia and her four children, Peter, Jack, George and Michael. From the time he spends with them, he writes the famous childrens novel `Peter Pan.

programme.title: Small Soldiers
programme.desc: A toy company develops action-figure soldiers whose realistic fighting capabilities cause mayhem for a toy-shop owner and his family. Unaware of their military prowess, the shop keeper takes delivery of the soldiers, who break free from their packaging to attack their Gorgonite enemies. When the Gorgonites communicate with the shop keepers son, the humans find themselves under siege.

programme.title: Johnny English
programme.desc: Spoof spy caper with the eponymous, blundering hero attempting to recover the crown jewels and save Britain from an evil mastermind when all the other agents are killed. Promoted from lowly pen pusher to super spy, Johnny English is baffled when clues lead to respected entrepreneur Pascal Sauvage, but could the enigmatic Lorna hold the key to the mystery?

programme.title: The Spiderwick Chronicles
programme.desc: Two twin brothers, Jared and Simon, and their sister Mallory are relocated by their mother to their great-great uncles creepy home in the middle of nowhere. Exploring, Jared finds his great-great uncles secret study and a book, the `Field Guide to the Fantastical World around Them, which opens up a world of goblins, spirits, ogres, trolls and griffins, some of whom are friendly and helpful and others not.

programme.title: Stardust
programme.desc: In a countryside town bordering on a magical land, a young man ventures into the realm of fairies to retrieve a fallen star in order to win the heart of his beloved.

programme.title: The Flintstones
programme.desc: Live-action version of the classic stone-age cartoon series. Fred Flintstone donates his family savings to help neighbour Barney Rubble and wife Betty adopt a child, much to the dismay of mother-in-law Pearl. To return the favour, Barney swaps slabs with Fred in an aptitude test, resulting in Freds being promoted and becoming involved in an embezzlement plot, while Barney is left in the dole queue.

programme.title: The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas
programme.desc: Prehistoric prequel in which working-class college leavers Fred and Barney decide to set off for a fun weekend in Rock Vegas with their two new girlfriends, Wilma and Betty. Fred, however, has a rival for the affections of his classy girlfriend Wilma - the wealthy playboy Chip Rockefeller.

programme.title: Bean: The Ultimate Disaster Movie
programme.desc: Mr Bean has somehow managed to get a job as a security guard. His latest assignment finds him travelling to America as an art expert, looking after the famous `Whistlers Mother painting as it is transported from Britain to a posh new Los Angeles museum. The catch is that Bean is no art expert and his trip was a ploy by his British employers to get rid of him. Unfortunately, no one has warned the Americans about Mr Bean.

programme.title: Zathura: A Space Adventure
programme.desc: Family adventure about two squabbling siblings who find a mysterious old board game in their basement. The bickering brothers discover the game has magical powers when a chance roll of the dice sends their house into deep space, where they must battle with aliens and work together to stay alive.

programme.title: Oliver!
programme.desc: Endearing film version of Lionel Barts successful stage musical based on Dickenss tale of the fluctuating fortunes of an orphan boy. Ron Moody stands out as the wily old scrounger Fagin in a series of well-crafted set-pieces and atmospheric musical numbers, and a tribe of child stars brings the 19th-century London underworld vividly to life.

programme.title: True Grit
programme.desc: John Wayne won an Oscar here as Rooster Cogburn, a lawman recruited by a teenager seeking revenge on her fathers murderer.

programme.title: Congo
programme.desc: A group set out on safari into the heart of the Congo. Each have their different reasons for the trip, but nothing could have prepared them for the greatest danger - a troop of intelligent killer apes.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: British POWs are ordered by their Japanese captors to construct a bridge of strategic importance and are happy to sabotage and delay the progress until their commanding officers orders them to continue the work unhindered to its completion, but are his actions tantamount to collaborating with the enemy?

programme.title: Two Mules for Sister Sara
programme.desc: Whimsical but engaging western about a drifter who saves a woman from a gang of marauders. The cowboy is astonished to learn that the woman is a nun, especially when he witnesses her heavy drinking and cigar-smoking ways. The unlikely pair embark on a voyage of discovery as they become embroiled in the Mexican War.

programme.title: The Mummy
programme.desc: The curse of an ancient mummy protects buried treasure in the Egyptian desert. An American mercenary who knows of the secret location is rescued from a Cairo prison by an English historian and her brother, and together they set off on a hunt. Along the way, the trio encounter flesh-eating scarab beetles, killer sandstorms, and reincarnated demons.

programme.title: Godzilla
programme.desc: Effects-laden blockbuster about a huge reptile which emerges from the sea to wreak havoc in Manhattan. On a research trip to Chernobyl, a young scientist discovers a startling link between genetic mutation and radioactivity. When a fishing trawler is attacked by an unseen creature, and other evidence of a massive reptilian creature is unearthed, he realises that the creature is following a destructive path to New York.

programme.title: Lake Placid
programme.desc: Following the death of a local diver, a New York palaeontologist is sent out to help the local fisheries warden investigate the case.

programme.title: The Cable Guy
programme.desc: After being kicked out of his apartment by his girlfriend, Steven hears that if he slips a cable guy $50, he can get hooked up with free cable - but at what further cost? Can Steven gently reject the cable guys insane attempts to be best buds and also get his girlfriend back?

programme.title: The Nutty Professor
programme.desc: Professor Sherman, a 450lb scientist, falls for his new colleague Professor Carla Purty, but out on a date, hes humiliated by a nightclub comedian about his weight. Upset and depressed, he takes a potion hes only tested previously on hamsters and - hey presto - he turns into a svelte and cool-talking babe-magnet, Buddy Love.

programme.title: Heaven Can Wait
programme.desc: An American footballer is given the body of a wealthy industrialist after an inept angel prematurely claims his life.

programme.title: Twins
programme.desc: Two very different twin brothers were born as a result of a genetic experiment. Following their birth, the flawless Julius grew up on a paradise island, while the less-than-perfect Vincent was sent to an orphanage. Now, many years later, Vincent is a thief and con man with huge debts. What will Julius think when he searches for his long-lost twin and finds him in jail?

programme.title: Housesitter
programme.desc: Newton Davis builds a dream home for his childhood sweetheart and is promptly dumped. Devastated, he seeks solace in the arms of a waitress, but sneaks off into the night once hes had his fun. The spurned waitress exacts her revenge by moving into the empty house and masquerading as Newtons wife. At this stage, things start getting complicated.

programme.title: Dumb and Dumber
programme.desc: A pair of idiotic friends set off on a madcap journey to return a briefcase to its owner. However, they are blissfully unaware that the case contains a large amount of ransom money for the owners kidnapped husband. Their trip is soon fraught with disaster, especially when the kidnappers begin to pursue them across the country with the aim of grabbing the cash.

programme.desc: Effects-laden blockbuster about a huge reptile which emerges from the sea to wreak havoc in Manhattan.
